frame.name: Judicial_body
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Source_of_authority</fen>, typically a government, relies upon a set of institutions specialized for the administration of justice. These <fen>Judicial_body</fen> s hear cases that originate within their <fen>Jurisdiction</fen> and relate to the <fen>Task</fen> given to them by the <fen>Source_of_authority</fen>. Often, a <fen>Judicial_body</fen> is part of a larger system within which its <fen>Rank</fen> can be specified. The <fen>Judicial_body</fen> is typically located in a specific location, the <fen>Seat</fen>.
<ex>The <fex name="Source_of_authority">federal</fex> <fex name="Judicial_body"><t>judiciary</t></fex>'s certification process is the foundation of the interpreter program. <fex name="Task">INI</fex> <fex name="Jurisdiction">DNI</fex></ex>
<ex>The city files an appeal with <fex name="Source_of_authority">the state's</fex> <fex name="Jurisdiction">Eastern District</fex> <fex name="Judicial_body"><t>Court</t></fex> <fex name="Task">of Appeals</fex>.</ex>
<ex>The case, tried in the <fex name="sou">US</fex> <fex name="Jurisdiction">District</fex> <fex name="Judicial_body"><t>Court</t></fex> <fex name="sea">in Boston</fex>, involved technical and financial issues regarding the feasibility of the project. <fex name="Task">INI</fex></ex>
<ex>On Oct. 31, the <fex name="Jurisdiction">Alaska</fex> <fex name="Source_of_authority">State</fex> <fex name="Rank">Superior</fex> <fex name="Judicial_body"><t>Court</t></fex> granted Chugach Electric Association's Oct. 3 request to dissolve the stay. <fex name="Task">INI</fex></ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Judicial_body
FE.definition:
<def-root>A permanent organization with the socially important purpose of administering justice.
<ex>The International Monetary Fund Administrative <fex name="jud"><t>Tribunal</t></fex> (IMFAT) adjudicates employment disputes between staff members and the IMF.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Domain
FE.definition:
<def-root>The concern of the <fen>Judicial_body</fen>-- broadly speaking, the aspect of society that they affect.
<ex>Anything you say or write can and will be held against you in a <t>court</t> <fex name="dom">of law</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Task
FE.definition:
<def-root>The responsibility that a <fen>Judicial_body</fen> has, either defined in terms of the type of cases that they can hear, or more specifically by reference to an action that the authority constituting them wishes the <fen>Judicial_body</fen> to achieve.
<ex>The International Criminal <t>Tribunal</t> <fex name="tas">for Rwanda</fex> sentenced Mikaeli Muhimana on April 28 to life imprisonment.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Rank
FE.definition:
<def-root>The degree of authority invested in a <fen>Judicial_body</fen> relative to other courts in the same system.
<ex>The <fex name="ran">High</fex> <t>Court</t> of Calcutta had all Bengal jurisdiction even after the partition of Bengal in 1905.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Seat
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location (typically a city) in which the <fen>Judicial_body</fen> hears cases.,
<ex>Ante Gotovina, was charged with war crimes by the International Criminal <t>Tribunal</t> <fex name="sea">in Den Hague</fex> and is currently hiding from the authorities.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Jurisdiction
FE.definition:
<def-root>The geographical area within which the <fen>Judicial_body</fen> has authority and responsibility.
<ex>On February 18, 1983, the Supreme <t>Court</t> <fex name="jur">of Alabama</fex> denied this motion.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Source_of_authority
FE.definition:
<def-root>The political entity under whose laws the <fen>Judicial_body</fen> is constituted and whose laws are applied.
<ex>A jury in the <fex name="sou">US</fex> District <t>Court</t> of Central California told Microsoft to pay a large award to Carlos Armando Amado.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Judges
FE.definition:
<def-root>The individuals that make up the <fen>Judicial_body</fen>.
<ex>I will not be heard before a <t>court</t> <fex name="mem">of 50-year-old white men</fex>!</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: court.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a body of people before whom judicial cases are heard.

lexUnit.name: tribunal.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a body established to settle certain types of dispute.

lexUnit.name: judiciary.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the judicial authorities of a country.

lexUnit.name: judicial.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: of, by, or appropriate to a law court or judge.
